intro: Jacquemontia glaucescens var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth jacquemontia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its climbing habit and tubular flowers. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a smooth texture and produces showy, trumpet-shaped blooms in shades of yellow to orange. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. The smooth jacquemontia is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits to pollinators.
